name: Subsunk
description:
Subsunk is a text adventure with graphics that was developed using the QUILL game development tool.

The player takes the role of a reporter, Ed Lines, from the Seafaring Gazette. Ed is out on assignment reporting on what life is like aboard a modern submarine. Ed gets more of a story than expected when the sub is attacked by an enemy power. He hides and, unlike the crew, escapes capture leaving him alone aboard the submarine at the bottom of the sea.

Ed's task is to find a way to summon aid by sending the SUBSUNK message back to HQ.
alsoFor: Amstrad CPC, ZX Spectrum | Combined View
gamePlay: Interactive fiction / text adventure, Puzzle elements

shot.caption: This is the start of the game. Its the first of a few narrative screens that set the scene
... and so our courageous reported hides
The final narrative screen includes some helpful commands. A full command list is on the reverse of the cassette insert
Ed emerges from hiding and the first picture is displayed
The game was written with a sense of humour
Aha! finding the emergency aerial was too easy, now Ed must find and use the components.
